hero.content: ASU Shrooms Society is dedicated to fostering an inclusive community of students and others interested in learning about and appreciating the diverse world of fungi.
hero.heading: What we do

events.eventDesc: Join the Shroom Society and Symbiotic farms for our second grow kit event. Learn about how mushrooms grow, and create your own oyster mushroom grow kit! Materials are first come first serve.
Join us as we explore various methods of cooking and enjoying mushrooms! Don't miss out on this culinary adventure; be sure to register on Sun Devils Sync to secure your spot!
Join us as we hike a trail by Lawrence Crossing Campground! Please rsvp on the form found in our Instagram bio and discord page for final confirmation, as spots are limited.

pastEvents.eventDesc: Join the Shroom Society with some festive crafts including painting and felting, while we learn about mushrooms!

Join the Shroom Society  as we hike hole in the rock trail and crosscut canal path. This hike is less than 2 miles total, but bring water and good shoes! The meet up location is Papago Park Visitor Center.

Prepare to be enchanted by the mysteries of the fungal kingdom as our esteemed president, a passionate mycologist, guides you through an engaging introductory session. In Mycology 101, we aim to ignite your curiosity and deepen your understanding of these often overlooked yet essential organisms.

points.pointDecs: 2-8 cm in diameter. conical to convex in shape. dry. smooth. and light brown to white in color.
5-15 cm long, 0.5-1.5 cm thick, cylindrical in shape, whitish to light yellow in color bruises blue when damaged.
Dark purplish brown to black in color, elliptical or oblong in shape.
Attachment to the underside of the cap, initially pinkish to purplish brown, maturing to dark purplish brown.
Thin membrane covering the gills when young, often leaving a ring or remants on the stem.
Psilocybin is known to induce profound alterations in consciousness, leading to expanded awareness, enhanced creativity, and a deeper sense of interconnectedness.
Research suggests that psilocybin can stimulate the growth of new brain cells, potentially promoting cognitive function and mental health
Many people report therapeutic effects from psilocybin, including relief from depression, anxiety, PTSD, and other mood disorders.
Psilocybin can dissolve the ego, leading to a sense of unity with the universe and a release from the limitations of the self.
For some individuals, psilocybin experiences provide a profound sense of spiritual insiaht. connection to higher consciousness. and transcendence of ordinary reality.
Psilocybin mushrooms have been used for thousands of years in spiritual rituals healing ceremonies and chamanic practices across cultures worldwide.
After a decades-long prohibition on psychedelic research, psilocybin has re-emerged as a promising treatment for mental health issues, with ongoing clinical trials demonstrating its efficacy.
While psilocybin mushrooms are classified as Schedule I substances in the United States, they are legal in several countries, including the Netherlands, Brazil, and Jamaica.
Microdosing psilocybin has gained popularity as a way to enhance focus, mood, and creativity while avoiding the intense effects of a full trip.
